name: Your X is going to apply for a final order as a sole applicant
body:
Case number: ((reference number))

Dear ((first name)) ((last name))

Your ((partner)) is intending to apply for a final order, as a sole applicant. If the final order is granted then your ((isDivorce??marriage))((isDissolution??civil partnership)) will be legally ended. This may affect your financial situation. This email gives you 14 days notice of their intention to apply.

#If you do nothing
Your ((partner)) will be able to apply to apply for final order from ((date plus 14 days)) as a sole applicant. If the court makes the final order then you ((isDivorce??marriage))((isDissolution??civil partnership)) will be legally ended. This may affect your finances.

#If you want more time to settle your finances
Your financial rights will change after the divorce is finalised, particularly in relation to any pension you have. 

 You can make an application to the court to delay the issuing of the final order. You can do this by filling out a D11 application form and sending it to the court. You need to do this by ((date plus 14 days)).

You can download the D11 form here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/form-d11-application-notice

Send it to the court by email or post. The address is on the form.  

#If you want to legally end your ((isDivorce??marriage))((isDissolution??civil partnership))
You can sign into your account and confirm your joint application for a final order. Only do this if you have finished negotiating money and property. 

((signin url))

Divorce and Dissolution
HM Courts & Tribunals Service
divorcecase@justice.gov.uk
0300 303 0642 (Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm)

Your feedback helps improve this service for others: https://www.smartsurvey.co.uk/s/Divorce_Feedback/?pageurl=/email
